23.q: What had the fathers of the scribes and Pharisees done to God's prophets?

23.a: The scribes and Pharisees were going to face the judgment of hell.
23.q: What judgment were the scribes and Pharisees going to face?

23.a: Jesus said they would kill and crucify some, whip some, and chase some from city to city.
23.q: What did Jesus say the scribes and Pharisees would do to the prophets, wise men, and scribes he would send them?

23.a: The guilt of all the righteous blood shed on the earth would come upon the scribes and Pharisees.
23.q: As a result of their behavior, what guilt would come upon the scribes and Pharisees?

23.a: Jesus said that to this generation all these things would happen.
23.q: To which generation did Jesus say all these things would happen?

23.a: Jesus desired to gather the children of Jerusalem together, but they would not agree.
23.q: What desire did Jesus have for the children of Jerusalem, and why was it not fulfilled?

23.a: Jerusalem's house would now be left abandoned.
23.q: How would Jerusalem's house now be left?

24.a: Jesus prophesied that not one stone of the temple would be left on another which would not be torn down.
24.q: What did Jesus prophesy concerning the temple in Jerusalem?

24.a: The disciples asked Jesus when these things would happen, and what would be the sign of his coming and the end of the world?
24.q: After hearing the prophesy about the temple, what did the disciples ask Jesus?

24.a: Jesus said many would come saying they are the Christ, leading many astray.
24.q: What kind of people did Jesus say would lead many astray?

24.a: Jesus said that wars, famines, and earthquakes would be the beginning of birth pains.
24.q: What events did Jesus say would be the beginning of birth pains?

24.a: Jesus said that the believers would suffer tribulation and that some would stumble and betray one another.
24.q: What did Jesus say would happen among the believers at this time?

24.a: Jesus said that the one who endures to the end will be saved.
24.q: Who did Jesus say would be saved?

24.a: The gospel of the kingdom will be preached in the whole world before the end comes.
24.q: What will happen with the gospel before the end comes?

24.a: Jesus said the believers should flee to the mountains.
24.q: What did Jesus say the believers should do when they see the abomination of desolation standing in the holy place? [24:15]

24.a: In those days, the tribulation will be great, greater than any from the beginning of the world.
24.q: How great will the tribulation be in those days?

24.a: The false Christs and false prophets will show great signs and wonders to lead many astray.
24.q: How will the false Christs and false prophets lead many astray?

24.a: The coming of the Son of Man will look like lightning shining from east to west.
24.q: What will the coming of the Son of Man look like?

24.a: The sun and moon will be darkened, and the stars will fall from the sky.
24.q: What will happen to the sun, moon, and stars after the tribulation of those days?

24.a: The tribes of the earth will beat their breasts.
24.q: What will the tribes of the earth do when they see the Son of Man coming in power and great glory?

24.a: The great sound of a trumpet will be heard when the angels gather the elect.
24.q: What sound will be heard as the Son of Man sends his angels to gather the elect?

24.a: Jesus said that this generation will not pass away until all these things have occurred.
24.q: What did Jesus say would not pass away until all these things have occurred?

24.a: Jesus said that heaven and earth will pass away, but that his words will never pass away.
24.q: What did Jesus say would pass away, and what would never pass away?

24.a: Only the Father knows when these events will occur.
24.q: Who knows when these events will occur?

24.a: The people will be eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, knowing nothing of the coming judgment that will take them away.
24.q: How will the coming of the Son of Man be like the days of Noah before the Flood?

24.a: Jesus said that his believers must always be ready, because they do not know what day the Lord will come.
24.q: What attitude did Jesus say his believers must maintain regarding his coming, and why?

24.a: A faithful and wise servant takes care of the master's household while the master is away.
24.q: What does a faithful and wise servant do while the master is away?

24.a: When he returns, the master sets the faithful and wise servant over everything that he owns.
24.q: What does the master do for the faithful and wise servant when he returns?

24.a: An evil servant beats his fellow servants and eats and drinks with drunkards while the master is away.
24.q: What does an evil servant do while the master is away?

24.a: When he returns, the master cuts the evil servant in two and sends him to where there is weeping and grinding of teeth.
24.q: What does the master do with the evil servant when he returns?

25.a: The foolish virgins did not take any oil with them along with their lamps.
25.q: What did the foolish virgins not do when they went to meet the bridegroom?

25.a: The wise virgins took containers of oil along with their lamps.
25.q: What did the wise virgins do when they went to meet the bridegroom?

25.a: The bridegroom came at midnight, which was later than the expected time.
25.q: When did the bridegroom come, and was this the expected time?

25.a: The wise virgins went with the bridegroom to the marriage feast.
25.q: What happened to the wise virgins when the bridegroom came?

25.a: The foolish virgins had to go buy oil, and when they returned the door to the feast was shut for them.
25.q: What happened to the foolish virgins when the bridegroom came?

25.a: Jesus said that the believers should watch, for they do not know the day or the hour.
25.q: What did Jesus say he wanted the believers to learn from the parable of the virgins?

25.a: The servant with five talents made another five talents, and the one with two talents made another two.
25.q: What did the servants with five and two talents do with their talents when their master went on his journey?

25.a: The servant with one talent dug a hole in the ground and hid his master's money.
25.q: What did the servant with one talent do with the talent when his master went on his journey?

25.a: The master was away for a long time.
25.q: How long was the master away on his journey?

25.a: The master said, "Well done, good and faithful servant!" and put them in charge of many things.
25.q: When he returned, what did the master do for the servants who had been given five and two talents?

25.a: The master said, "You wicked and lazy servant," took the one talent away from him, and threw him into the outer darkness.
25.q: When he returned, what did the master do to the servant who had been given one talent?

25.a: The Son of Man will gather all the nations and separate the people one from another.
25.q: What will the Son of Man do when he comes and sits on his glorious throne?

25.a: Those on the King's right hand receive the kingdom prepared for them from the foundation of the world.
25.q: What will those on the King's right hand receive?

25.a: Those on the King's right hand gave food to the hungry, drink to the thirsty, took in strangers, clothed the naked, cared for the sick, and visited the prisoners.
25.q: What did those on the King's right hand do in their lives?

25.a: Those on the King's left hand receive the eternal fire prepared for the devil and his angels.
25.q: What will those on the King's left hand receive?

25.a: Those on the King's left hand did not give food to the hungry, drink to the thirsty, take in strangers, clothe the naked, care for the sick, or visit the prisoners.
25.q: What did those on the King's left hand not do in their lives?

26.a: Jesus said that the Passover was coming in two days.
26.q: What Jewish feast did Jesus say was coming in two days?

26.a: They were plotting to arrest Jesus stealthily and to kill him.
26.q: What were the chief priests and elders plotting at the palace of the chief priest?

26.a: They were afraid that if they killed Jesus during the feast, the people might riot.
26.q: Of what were the chief priests and elders afraid?

26.a: The disciples were angry and wanted to know why the ointment was not sold and the money given to the poor.
26.q: What was the disciples' reaction when the woman poured the expensive ointment on Jesus' head?

26.a: Jesus said the woman had poured the ointment on him for his burial.
26.q: Why did Jesus say the woman had poured the ointment on him?

26.a: Judas was paid thirty pieces of silver to deliver Jesus into the hands of the chief priests.
26.q: What was Judas Iscariot paid to deliver Jesus into the hands of the chief priests?

26.a: Jesus said that one of his disciples would betray him.
26.q: What did Jesus say at the evening meal about one of his disciples?

26.a: Jesus said that it would be better for the man who betrays him if he had never been born.
26.q: What did Jesus say about the future of the one who would betray him?

26.a: Jesus answered, "You have said it yourself".
26.q: How did Jesus answer when Judas asked if he was the one who would betray Jesus?

26.a: Jesus said, "Take, eat. This is my body".
26.q: What did Jesus say when he took the bread, blessed it, broke it, and gave it to the disciples?

26.a: Jesus said that the cup was his blood of the covenant that is poured out for many for the forgiveness of sins.
26.q: What did Jesus say about the cup he then gave to the disciples?

26.a: Jesus told his disciples that they would all fall away that night because of him.
26.q: At the Mount of Olives, what did Jesus tell his disciples they would all do that night?

26.a: Jesus said that Peter would deny Jesus three times that night before the rooster crows.
26.q: When Peter said he would never fall away, what did Jesus tell him he would do that night?

26.a: Jesus asked them to remain there and watch with him.
26.q: What did Jesus ask Peter and the two sons of Zebedee to do while he prayed?

26.a: Jesus requested that if it were possible, to let this cup pass from him.
26.q: What request did Jesus make to the Father in his prayer?

26.a: The disciples were sleeping when Jesus returned from praying.
26.q: What were the disciples doing when Jesus returned from praying?

26.a: Jesus prayed that the Father's will be done, no matter Jesus' own will.
26.q: What did Jesus pray be done, no matter Jesus' own will?

26.a: Jesus left the disciples three times to go and pray.
26.q: How many times did Jesus leave the disciples to go and pray?

26.a: Judas kissed Jesus as the sign to the crowd that Jesus was the one to seize.
26.q: What sign did Judas give the crowd to identify Jesus as the one to seize?

26.a: One of Jesus' disciples drew his sword and cut off the ear of the servant of the high priest.
26.q: What did one of Jesus' disciples do when Jesus was seized?

26.a: Jesus said that he could call upon the Father, who would send twelve legions of angels.
26.q: What did Jesus say he could do if he wished to defend himself?

26.a: Jesus said that the scriptures were being fulfilled by these events.
26.q: What did Jesus say was being fulfilled by these events?

26.a: All the disciples then left him and fled.
26.q: What did all the disciples then do?

26.a: They were looking for false testimony against Jesus in order to put Jesus to death.
26.q: For what were the chief priests and the whole Council looking in order to put Jesus to death?

26.a: The high priest commanded Jesus tell them whether or not he was the Christ, the Son of God.
26.q: What command did the high priest give Jesus by the living God?

26.a: Jesus said, "You have said it yourself".
26.q: What was Jesus' response to the high priest's command?

26.a: Jesus said the high priest would see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of Power, and coming on the clouds of heaven.
26.q: What did Jesus say the high priest would see?

26.a: The high priest accused Jesus of blasphemy.
26.q: What accusation did the high priest then make against Jesus?

26.a: They spat in Jesus' face, beat him, and struck him with the palms of their hands.
26.q: What did they do to Jesus after they accused him?

26.a: Peter answered that he did not know Jesus.
26.q: What did Peter answer the three times that someone asked him if he was with Jesus?

26.a: As soon as Peter answered the third time, a rooster crowed.
26.q: What happened as soon as Peter answered the third time?

26.a: Peter remembered that Jesus had said that before the rooster crows, he would deny Jesus three times.
26.q: What did Peter remember after his third answer?

27.a: In the morning, they took him to Pilate the governor.
27.q: In the morning, where did the chief priests and elders take Jesus?

27.a: Judas repented of betraying innocent blood, returned the silver, went out, and hanged himself.
27.q: What did Judas Iscariot do when he saw that Jesus was condemned?

27.a: They bought the Potter's Field in which to bury strangers.
27.q: What did the chief priests do with the thirty pieces of silver?

27.a: These events fulfilled the prophecy of Jeremiah.
27.q: Whose prophecy did these events fulfill?

27.a: Pilate asked Jesus if he was the King of the Jews, and Jesus answered, "You say so".
27.q: What question did Pilate ask Jesus, and what was Jesus' answer?

27.a: Jesus did not answer even one word.
27.q: What did Jesus answer to all the accusations of the chief priests and elders?

27.a: Pilate wished to have Jesus released, following the custom of the feast.
27.q: What did Pilate wish to do for Jesus, following the custom of the feast of Passover?

27.a: She told Pilate to have nothing to do with that innocent man.
27.q: What message did Pilate's wife send to him as he was sitting on the judgment-seat?

27.a: The chief priests and elders persuaded the crowd to ask for Barabbas to be released instead of Jesus.
27.q: Why was Barabbas, and not Jesus released according to the custom of the feast?

27.a: The crowd cried out that they wanted Jesus to be crucified.
27.q: What did the crowd cry out that they wanted done with Jesus?

27.a: Pilate washed his hands, said he was innocent of this innocent man's blood, and gave Jesus over to the crowd.
27.q: When Pilate saw a riot was starting, what did he do?

27.a: The people said, "May his blood be on us and our children".
27.q: What did the people say when Pilate handed Jesus to them?

27.a: The soldiers put a scarlet robe on him and a crown of thorns on his head.
27.q: What did the soldiers of the governor put on Jesus?

27.a: Simon was forced to carry Jesus' cross.
27.q: What was Simon of Cyrene forced to do?

27.a: They went to Golgotha, which means "The Place of a Skull".
27.q: Where did they go to crucify Jesus?

27.a: The soldiers cast lots to divide up Jesus' garments and then sat and watched him.
27.q: What did the soldiers do after they crucified Jesus?

27.a: They wrote, "THIS IS JESUS THE KING OF THE JEWS".
27.q: What writing did they put above Jesus' head?

27.a: Two robbers were crucified with Jesus, one on his right and one on his left.
27.q: Who was crucified with Jesus?

27.a: They all challenged Jesus to save himself and come down from the cross.
27.q: What did the people, the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders challenge Jesus to do?

27.a: Darkness came over the whole land from the sixth to the ninth hour.
27.q: What happened from the sixth to the ninth hour?

27.a: Jesus cried out, "My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?"
27.q: What did Jesus cry out at the ninth hour?

27.a: Jesus gave up his spirit.
27.q: What happened after Jesus cried out again with a loud voice?

27.a: The curtain of the temple was split in two from the top to the bottom after Jesus died.
27.q: What happened in the temple after Jesus died?

27.a: Many saints that had fallen asleep were raised and appeared to many after Jesus died.
27.q: What happened at the tombs after Jesus died?

27.a: The centurion testified, "Truly this was the Son of God".
27.q: Seeing all these events, what was the testimony of the centurion?

27.a: A rich disciple of Jesus, Joseph, asked Pilate for the body, wrapped it in linen, and laid it in his own new tomb.
27.q: After he was crucified, what happened to the body of Jesus?

27.a: A large stone was placed across the door of the tomb where Jesus' body was laid.
27.q: What was placed across the door of the tomb where Jesus' body was laid?

27.a: The chief priests and the Pharisees wanted to make sure that Jesus' tomb was secure so that no one could steal the body.
27.q: Why did the chief priests and the Pharisees gather with Pilate the next day?

27.a: Pilate permitted them to seal the stone and place a guard at the tomb.
27.q: What did Pilate permit them to do at the tomb?

28.a: As it began to dawn toward the first day of the week, they went to Jesus' tomb.
28.q: What day and time did Mary Magdalene and the other Mary go to Jesus' tomb?

28.a: An angel of the Lord descended and rolled away the stone.
28.q: How was the stone rolled away from Jesus' tomb?

28.a: The guards shook with fear and became like dead men when they saw the angel.
28.q: What did the guards do when they saw the angel?

28.a: The angel said that Jesus had risen and was going ahead of them to Galilee.
28.q: What did the angel say to the two women about Jesus?

28.a: The women met Jesus, and they took hold of his feet and worshiped him.
28.q: What happened to the two women on their way to tell the disciples?

28.a: The chief priests paid the soldiers a large amount of money and told them to say that Jesus' disciples had stolen the body.
28.q: When the guards told the chief priests what had happened at the tomb, what did the chief priests do?

28.a: The disciples worshiped Jesus, but some doubted.
28.q: What did the disciples do when they saw Jesus in Galilee?

28.a: Jesus said that all authority in heaven and on earth had been given to him.
28.q: What authority did Jesus say had been given to him?

28.a: Jesus commanded his disciples to go and make disciples, and to baptize them.
28.q: What did Jesus command his disciples to do?

28.a: Jesus told his disciples to baptize in the name of the Father, of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit.
28.q: Into what name did Jesus tell his disciples to baptize?

28.a: Jesus commanded his disciples to teach the nations to obey all the things he had commanded.
28.q: What did Jesus command his disciples to teach?

28.a: Jesus promised to be with them, even to the end of the world.
28.q: What final promise did Jesus give his disciples?
